content.description:
Start with straightforward face climbing up the first nine bolts.  From there, three permadraws protect an overhung bird poop infested crack of solid hand jams.  Follow two more permadraws as you lieback and traverse right along a steep ledge/ramp  to the two mussys that make the anchors.

Note: Just before the anchors, it may be best to avoid trying to get too high of a handhold above the lip.  There seems to be some loose rock that one might pull off onto their belayer.
content.protection: 9 Bolts, 5 permadraws, 2 bolts for anchors w/ mussy's.  70m rope necessary.
content.location: This route ascends straight up the middle of The Octagon's face into the highest, most central pointed corner of the Octagon's most prominent roof.  This route follows the most aesthetic line possible up this wall - it's a true miracle of a route.  Bushwack your way through trees to situate yourself directly beneath the first bolt.

content.description:
Nice 10b warmup route for the other harder routes at The Octagon.  This is the easiest route at the crag.  There is currently (at the time of this posting) an ongoing open project that extends out the roof beyond the bolted anchor.

Start at a head-hight knifeblade just above a roof-like bulge at the base of the wall.  Climb up bolted technical face climbing to a delicate traverse left to the anchors.
content.location: This route starts by following up a weakness that is a bit left of the left facing corner of The Octagon. Look for a knifeblade that is just above a roof that is very close to the ground.  There will be a line of bolts above this knifeblade.
